entry.title: What If Actions Had Consequences
entry.summary:
Author: phyl29

Summary: What if Eddie and Buck had gotten together after the shooting and almost immediately got married with Buck adopting Chris?What if Buck had insisted that all three of them get intensive therapy as they officially became a family?What if Helena and Ramon were irate about the marriage and adoption and became even more obsessed with taking Chris through both legal and illegal means?What if, several years later, a happily married and mentally healthy Eddie and Buck encountered Kim at the mall?What if Helena and Ramon tried to use Kim to drive a wedge between their son, his husband, and their grandchild?What if Helena and Ramon finally learned that actions have consequences?

entry.title: Aftershock
entry.summary:
Author: MrsM

Summary: Buck never expected his past to catch up with him. After years of trying to build a new life, an unexpected new recruit threatens to unravel everything. Secrets, regrets, and unexpected connections force him to face the wreckage he thought he left behind. But sometimes, the real impact isn’t in the first quake—it’s in the aftershock.orBuck has tried to forget his time in El Paso, but he is forced to remember when the 118 gets a new probie, Eddie Diaz.

entry.title: Dead Like Buck
entry.summary:
Author: LittleMilksuker

Summary: Death exists as a force of nature. Grim reapers collect souls. Buck is a reaper. The hows, whens, whos, whats and whys will be revealed as they come into fruition. This will not be in context, nor will canon be followed closely. In fact, I'd go so far as to say this will written as a significant "fuck you" to all things canon -- characters, actions taken, inaction -- in a hopefully darkly comical and satisfying way (assuming I finish this) that leaves the reader feeling catharsis when certain people bite it. I don't believe in justice but for the sake of this fic, bad karma, irony, murphy's law and graeveling machinations will come to pass. I don't know why or how they come up but I have gotten a kick out of a few Sentinel-Guide/9-1-1 mashups and thought a Dead Like Me lens might be cool.

entry.title: A job that slowly kills you, bruises that won't heal (I'll take a quiet life)
entry.summary:
Author: JasonToddsDevotedWife

Summary: ' Buck, speak of the devil, dropped down the last few feet. Bracing one foot against the rocky cliff and the other against the bumper, he secured his line and glanced up. The moment his eyes met Hondo’s, he faltered, foot slipping slightly against the rock.“You okay, kid?”It was impressive, the speed with which Buck recollected himself. Other than a slight downward quirk to his lips as though he had swallowed something sour, there was nothing on his face to tip off discomfort. An odd reaction, as far as he knew Buck had never met this man before. Eddie couldn’t help but furrow his brow. ' Evan "Buck" Buckley doesn't lie to his loved ones. At least, not any more than he needs to. He's made quite the life for himself at the 118 with people he loves and not a care in the world (at least, as far as anybody can tell) about his past before the 118. His past that he has historically been a bit vague about. When a blast from the past appears on a call, he is realizing that he might not have gotten away so scott-free from his past occupation. Cue Eddie noticing. Now, Buck has to navigate the collision between his past and his present.

entry.title: Keeping It Quiet
entry.summary:
Author: bellabrady

Summary: He can’t handle standing next to Eddie for however long it takes to clean the engine, he just can’t. He’s going to lose it. And he’s going to lose Eddie, too, because he’ll inevitably either kiss him or confess his undying love. He can’t even guarantee he won’t just drop down on one knee and propose.“Oh, yeah, I’ll be right there, Bobby!” Buck yells before dropping his rag into the bucket and taking off towards the loft, leaving Eddie standing there dumbfounded.“Buck, no one was calling for you!” he shouts, exasperated. Buck ignores him and bounds up the stairs.—Or: Buck realizes he's in love with Eddie shortly before a 24 hour shift. Out of fear of accidentally confessing his love, Buck tries to avoid him at all costs. If only Eddie wasn't so derermined to talk to him.

entry.title: my world was in black and white until I saw your light
entry.summary:
Author: Maklee13

Summary: After it all, Eddie was falling apart, failing at putting himself back together, this time he was truly alone.Buck had Tommy, Chris was in Texas, and everyone else had their own families to worry about, so here he was, lost, alone, and haunted by his bad decisions and inability to forgive himself.Eddie’s self loathing led to him depriving himself of joys, well, that was until it happened, the last lightning strike being washed away by pure devotion and complete and utter ruin.Love.Eddie was in love.Scratch that, Eddie is in love with his best friend.Eddie loves buck.

entry.title: Once More (With Feeling)
entry.summary:
Author: Strawberrywaltz

Summary: “I told him you could help.” Christopher says with such confidence that Eddie’s heart jumps into his throat. Because to Eddie, this isn’t a fight he can win. “Please help him.”“Christopher.” Eddie whispers and looks back down at the likely dying wild animal his son brought home.“Please?” Christopher’s eyes are wide and wet and looking at him with such hope.What can Eddie do? Say no? Of course not. “I’ll try, but Mijo, it looks pretty hurt.”“You can save him.” Christopher insists. “I know you can.”__Or: Christopher saves a fox on a field trip that ends up not being a fox after all.

entry.title: The Other Buckley?
entry.summary:
Author: H1am_Gh0st

Summary: A new guy starts at the 118 his last name? Also happens to be buckley. As the 118 grows closer to the new guy buck starts to feel jealous and an odd feeling like he's gonna be replaced.
